ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: REST-*

Hey Jan,

> You are aware that on this list WS-* usually is used to convey
> explicitly the image of WS-death star, yes? "RESTifying the
> enterprise" would maybe convey in a more rest-discuss friendly way the
> image you had intended to convey :-)

I support that notion of Web-ifying the enterprise. I think we all  
would really: what works on the big Web can be scaled down to work in  
less ambitious environments like enterprise systems.

My stumbling block is that it's a platform vendor driving this, and I  
can't help but feel there's a potential for conflict of interest.

Red Hat could do much more sensible and ambitious things than mooch  
around with enterprise middleware - they certainly have the talent and  
bandwidth to do something radical. If I wore a Red Hat, then I'd be  
pushing to build a kick-ass Web server and nice frameworks around it  
to deal with things like hypermedia formats and business protocols  
(i.e. not JAX-RS). Then I'd declare victory for the Web over  
middleware (mostly) and wrong-foot the opposition in the process.  
Lovely.

Jim
